qas.question: What historical significance can the book The History of Mary Prince claim?

answers.text: The first notable, and historically important, book credited to a Bermudian

qas.question: What contribution to history is it believed the History of Mary Prince made?

answers.text: thought to have contributed to the abolition of slavery in the British Empire

qas.question: The majority of books published by local authors were of what nature?
Which local author most recently enjoyed success for published works of fiction?
What was the first book credited to a Bermudian?
Who wrote The History of Prince Mary?
What is thought to have contributed to the abolition of slavery in Bermuda?
When did Graham Ernest Ingham publish books?
During what years did Angela Barry live?

context: <a0_0>The first notable, and historically important, book credited to a Bermudian<a0_0/> was <b4_0><b6_0>The History of Mary Prince<b6_0/><b4_0/>, a slave narrative by <b5_0>Mary Prince<b5_0/>. It is <a1_0>thought to have contributed to the abolition of slavery in the British Empire<a1_0/>. Ernest Graham Ingham, an expatriate author, published his books at the turn of the <b7_0>19th and 20th centuries<b7_0/>. In the 20th century, numerous books were written and published locally, though few were directed at a wider market than Bermuda. (The latter consisted primarily of <a2_0>scholarly<a2_0/> works rather than creative writing). The novelist Brian Burland (<b8_0>1931– 2010<b8_0/>) achieved a degree of success and acclaim internationally. More recently, <a3_0>Angela Barry<a3_0/> has won critical recognition for her published fiction.
